front: Who said: "We cannot conceive of any end or limit to the world, but always as of necessity it occurs to us that there is something beyond."
Who said: "The God who gave us life, gave us liberty at the same time; the hand of force may destroy, but cannot disjoin them."
Who said: "To love truth for truth's sake is the principal part of human perfection in this world, and the seed-plot of all other virtues."
Who said: "If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him."
Who said: "I disapprove of what you say, but will defend to the death your right to say it."
What nom de plume was used by Fran√ßois-Marie Arouet?
